title: Aluminum Rises to 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,862.80 per tonne on October 23, 2025, up 1.89% from the previous day and reaching a three-year high. The price increase is driven by tight supply conditions, including China's aluminum output cap of 45 million tons, which is expected to be breached this year.

title: Macro and Fundamentals Resonate Positively, Aluminum Prices Expected to Fluctuate at Highs [SMM Aluminum Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: On October 23, the most-traded SHFE aluminum contract closed at 21,265 yuan/mt, up 0.64%, with prices expected to hover at highs in the short term. Technical indicators show a bullish trend, with resistance projected between 21,400-21,580 yuan/mt and support between 20,730-20,930 yuan/mt, though caution is advised for potential pullbacks.

title: LME Aluminium cash price rises 0.92% on October 23, inventories down 4,850t
summary: The LME aluminium cash price increased by 0.92% to USD 2,843 per tonne on October 23, 2025, accompanied by a decline in inventories by 4,850 tonnes, indicating tightening supply conditions in the market.

title: Here's why these three Aluminium-linked stocks are in focus on Friday
summary: Shares of Hindalco Ltd., Nalco Ltd., and Vedanta Ltd. rose over 3% on October 24 as LME aluminum prices crossed $2,850 per tonne. The surge is attributed to tight global supply, a smelter shutdown in Iceland affecting 100 kt of production, and prospects of global monetary easing. US-listed Alcoa Corp shares gained 12% following CEO comments that current prices cover tariff impacts.

title: Aluminum Stocks Rally as LME Prices Surge Past $2,850 Per Tonne
summary: Indian aluminum stocks including Hindalco, Nalco, and Vedanta saw price increases between 0.30% and 1.60% as LME aluminum prices surged past $2,850 per tonne. The rally is driven by tight global supply-demand dynamics, a smelter shutdown in Iceland, and expectations of global monetary easing. Alcoa Corporation's shares jumped 12% after CEO remarks on tariff impacts.

title: Alcoa to own just 5pc of WA plant to bust China's dominance of gallium supply
summary: Alcoa will own only 5% of a new gallium plant in Western Australia aimed at reducing China's dominance in gallium supply, a critical mineral used in semiconductors and electronics. The plant leverages Alcoa's Wagerup alumina refinery and aligns with government interests to diversify supply chains outside China.

title: Evonik Strengthens Asian Presence with New Aluminum Specialty Plant in Japan
summary: Evonik has opened its first advanced fumed alumina production facility 'Alu5' in Yokkaichi, Japan, producing AEROXIDE®, a high-performance fumed aluminum oxide. The plant supports regional growth, reduces lead times and carbon footprint, and enhances supply security for industries including electric mobility and electronics.

title: Norsk Hydro: Solid results amid uncertain markets
summary: Norsk Hydro reported a decrease in adjusted EBITDA for Aluminium Metal in Q3 2025 due to currency effects despite higher sales volumes and lower alumina costs. Global primary aluminium consumption remained flat, with growth in China offsetting declines elsewhere. Extrusion demand in Europe was flat year-over-year but down seasonally from the previous quarter.

title: Aluminium producer Norsk Hydro's Q3 core profit lags expectations
summary: Norsk Hydro reported an 18.6% decline in third-quarter core profit, impacted by lower alumina prices and a stronger Norwegian crown, partially offset by increased production volumes. The results reflect ongoing market challenges in the aluminium sector.

title: Ford lowers annual guidance, citing fire at supplier's aluminum plant
summary: Ford Motor Company reduced its profit guidance due to a fire at Novelis' aluminum plant in Oswego, New York, which supplies aluminum for Ford's F-150 trucks. The disruption is expected to reduce production by up to 100,000 units through the end of 2025, with Novelis aiming to restart affected operations by December.

title: Kaiser Aluminum Corporation Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: Kaiser Aluminum announced third quarter 2025 financial results including net sales of $844 million and net income of $40 million. The report highlights ongoing operational performance amid current market conditions.

title: LME Aluminium cash price rises 0.92% on October 23, inventories down 4,850t
summary: The London Metal Exchange (LME) aluminium cash price increased by 0.92% to USD 2,843 per tonne on October 23, 2025, while aluminium inventories declined by 4,850 tonnes, indicating tightening supply conditions.

title: Investing In Innovation: GBCCA Showcases New Technology To Close The Recycling Loop For Aluminium Cans
summary: The GBCCA presented breakthrough technologies at the International Aluminium Institute event during Climate Week NYC, focusing on autonomous sorting and recovery of aluminium cans from municipal waste. Innovations include robotics and AI systems, advanced material recovery facilities, large-scale deposit return machines, and next-generation home recycling systems, all aimed at accelerating aluminium circularity and supporting decarbonisation through recycling.

title: AL Circle x Takuo Harato: Advancing sustainability and innovation in the global aluminium industry
summary: Takuo Harato, an alumina production technology consultant, discussed key sustainability challenges in the aluminium industry, emphasizing the need for carbon neutrality and green aluminium production. He highlighted energy efficiency improvements in refining processes, such as heat exchanger and heat recovery systems, as critical steps to reduce energy consumption and carbon emissions.

title: Evonik Strengthens Asian Presence with New Aluminum Specialty Production Facility
summary: Evonik opened its new state-of-the-art fumed alumina production plant 'Alu5' in Yokkaichi, Japan, producing AEROXIDE®, an advanced fumed aluminum oxide that enhances performance and durability in electric mobility, electronics, and sustainable coatings. The facility reduces lead times and carbon footprint, supporting sustainable innovation and regional growth in Asia.

title: ET Startup Awards 2025: Chakr Innovation eyes international foray and new technology
summary: Chakr Innovation is developing clean-tech solutions including an aluminium-air energy storage technology as an alternative to lithium-ion batteries, leveraging India's abundant aluminium reserves. The startup is scaling commercial deployments and overcoming challenges related to hardware manufacturing and regulatory support under India's National Clean Air Programme.

title: Can a-metal Democratize Access to Laser Fusion Technology?
summary: a-metal, a startup spun off from ETH Zurich, is developing compact, affordable metal 3D printing solutions using laser powder bed fusion to make metal additive manufacturing accessible to SMEs. Their technology aims to reduce machine size and complexity while increasing robustness, enabling broader adoption of metal 3D printing for sustainable manufacturing.

title: Steel prices hit five-year low; weak trend likely to persist in near term
summary: Domestic steel prices have dropped to a five-year low, trading between Rs 47,000-48,000 per tonne due to multiple factors including surging imports and weak export demand. Hot rolled coil prices hover around Rs 47,150 per tonne, while re-bar prices range from Rs 46,500-47,000 per tonne, levels last seen during the 2020 pandemic slowdown.

title: Steel fell to 3,035 CNY/T on October 24, 2025, down 0.16% from the previous day
summary: Steel prices declined slightly to 3,035 CNY per tonne on October 24, 2025, down 0.16% from the previous day. Over the past month, steel prices have fallen 1.37% and are down 6.41% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect prices to continue declining to around 2,875.97 CNY/MT within 12 months.

title: US scrap trends outlook: October 2025
summary: Ferrous scrap prices in the US are expected to fall further in October 2025, continuing a downward trend from September. Market participants cite lower demand as the primary driver, with bearish sentiment across buyers, brokers, and sellers. Inventories remain slightly below average, indicating supply constraints are unlikely to support prices.

title: Steel Ministry to Address Import Issues with Industry Stakeholders on October 27
summary: The Ministry of Steel will hold an Open House on October 27, 2025, to address steel import-related concerns amid rising imports that have pressured domestic steel prices and market share. The session aims to facilitate direct interaction with industry stakeholders to discuss issues related to SIMS, NOC, QCO, and other import matters.

title: JSW Steel Ltd: Live Stock Update and Price as of October 24, 2025
summary: JSW Steel Ltd's share price experienced a slight increase of 0.34%, actively trading at ₹1,145.00 as of October 24, 2025. This reflects a positive upturn in the company's stock performance amid current market conditions.

title: Global crude steel production falls 1.6% in September
summary: Global crude steel production decreased by 1.6% in September compared to the same period last year, primarily due to a 4.6% decline in Chinese production. Despite this, countries like the US and India saw increases in production. Türkiye's production rose by 3.3% to 3.2 million tons.

title: Steel prices hit five-year low; weak trend likely to persist in near term
summary: Domestic steel prices in India have dropped to a five-year low, influenced by rising imports and stable raw material costs. The Ministry of Steel is set to discuss these issues with industry stakeholders. India remains a net importer of steel despite increased exports.

title: EU's Proposed Tariffs on Steel to Address Excess Capacity and Enable Decarbonization Could Worsen Trade Tensions
source: Columbia University's Center on Global Energy Policy
summary: The EU's proposed tariffs on steel aim to address excess capacity and promote decarbonization but may exacerbate trade tensions. The regulation could impact global steel trade dynamics and compliance with trade norms.

title: Reinventing Steel for a Stronger, Lighter, Greener Future
summary: Next-generation steel is transforming construction with stronger, lighter alloys and low-carbon manufacturing. Innovations in green steel are enabling more sustainable building designs and reducing embodied carbon, though challenges remain in scaling production and cost competitiveness.

title: The Global Steel Industry 2025: At a Pivotal Crossroads
summary: The steel industry is undergoing major changes with AI integration, green steel production, hydrogen use, automation, and a strong focus on sustainability and recycling. These innovations are reshaping manufacturing processes and driving demand for low-carbon steel materials globally.

title: Steel Tech 2025: The event where steel, technology and innovation shape its future
summary: Steel Tech 2025 congress and expo in Bilbao gathers industry leaders and experts to discuss challenges and innovations in steel technology, including carbon-free energy sources, AI applications, and CO2 capture and valorisation. The event highlights the sector’s commitment to sustainability and technological advancement.

title: GPH Ispat pioneers green steel in Bangladesh with most advanced technology
summary: GPH Ispat is leading green steel production in Bangladesh by adopting Q-EAF technology, investing in renewable energy, and emphasizing sustainability. This positions the company at the forefront of environmentally responsible steel manufacturing in the region.

title: SteelDays Celebrates Sustainability
summary: SteelDays highlights innovations and leadership in steel sustainability, showcasing cutting-edge mills and sustainable practices that reinforce steel as a highly sustainable construction material.

title: Tetelo Copper Ore Project Is Expected to Commence Production; LME Copper Rose Sharply Overnight
summary: The Tetelo copper mine project in Angola is set to start production, marking a significant development for the country's mining sector. Meanwhile, LME copper prices rose sharply overnight, reaching a high of $10,876 per tonne before closing at $10,817 per tonne. This increase reflects ongoing supply disruptions and robust demand.

title: Copper Prices Rise
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange rose 1.6% to USD10,834 a metric ton, marking its highest level since October 14. This increase is attributed to ongoing market dynamics and supply constraints.

title: Copper Strides Higher on Hopes for Stimulus After China Plenum
summary: Copper prices have increased due to expectations that China will introduce new stimulus measures in its five-year plan. This potential stimulus could bolster demand from China, the world's top metals consumer.

title: Weekly Overseas Copper News Roundup Oct 20-24
summary: Antofagasta reported Q3 2025 copper production of 161,800 metric tons, up 1% quarter-on-quarter, with full-year production expected at the low end of 660,000–700,000 metric tons. Freeport-McMoRan's Q3 copper production declined year-on-year to 912 million pounds due to a mudslide incident and lower ore grades but profits exceeded expectations due to rising copper prices.

title: Tetelo Copper Ore Project Is Expected to Commence Production
summary: The Tetelo copper mine project in Uíge Province, Angola, controlled by Chinese company Shining Star Icarus, is expected to start production soon. The project involves an initial open-pit mining phase with an annual output of about 25,000 metric tons of copper concentrates, transitioning to underground mining in the second half of 2026, marking a significant expansion of Angola's copper capacity.

title: Angola Opens First Major Copper Mine in $250 Million Push Beyond Oil
summary: Angola launched its first large-scale copper mine, the Tetelo project, valued at $250 million and owned by China's Shining Star Icarus. The mine is expected to produce 25,000 metric tons of copper concentrate annually during its first two years, transitioning from open-pit to underground mining in 2026, supporting Angola's economic diversification and positioning it as a key player in the global clean energy minerals market.

title: Antofagasta 9-month Copper Production Rises
summary: Antofagasta reported copper production of 476,600 tonnes for the first nine months of 2025, a 3% increase year-on-year, driven by higher output at Centinela Concentrates. The company expects full-year 2025 copper production to be at the lower end of its guidance range of 660,000 to 700,000 tonnes, with a forecasted increase in 2026 at Los Pelambres.

title: Robert Friedland says global economy faces copper crisis
summary: Industry veteran Robert Friedland warns that global copper demand is accelerating and could outstrip supply within two decades, requiring mining of as much copper in the next 18 years as in the past 10,000 years combined. Despite copper prices rising to over $5 per pound, Friedland argues prices need to reach $15,000 per tonne to justify new mine investments critical for the energy transition.

title: Indonesia may allow copper miner Amman Mineral to export copper concentrate
summary: Indonesia is considering allowing copper miner Amman Mineral International to resume copper concentrate exports after a fire at its smelter caused technical constraints. The government banned concentrate exports in mid-2023 to boost domestic processing but may grant exemptions under force majeure conditions, with the export permit process underway.

title: More high-grade copper discovered at Rae
summary: New discoveries of high-grade copper have been reported at the Rae project, indicating promising exploration results that could enhance copper production capacity in the region.

title: Solis Minerals (ASX:SLM) Boosts Copper Plans with Cucho Move
summary: Solis Minerals has gained full option to acquire the Cucho Copper Project and has begun the exploration phase with strong geological groundwork, aiming to expand its copper production potential.

title: Codelco and Ennomotive Launch Global Challenge to Reduce Mining Dust
summary: Codelco and Ennomotive have launched a global challenge to find solutions for reducing airborne dust generated by the interaction between underground and open-pit mining operations. The challenge seeks technologies that can efficiently measure, control, and mitigate dust with minimal human intervention and low environmental impact. Solutions must be compatible with daily operations and withstand extreme weather conditions.

title: Torchlight and Innovation Mining Unite as RZOLV Technologies
summary: Torchlight Innovations Inc. has merged with Innovation Mining to form RZOLV Technologies, marking a significant step in clean-technology mining. RZOLV offers a non-toxic, water-based process as an alternative to cyanide and smelting, reducing environmental impact. The company has commenced trading on the TSX Venture Exchange.

title: Copper Ore Concentrate & Refining Process: Top Innovations
summary: The copper industry is adopting advanced technologies like AI monitoring, satellite imaging, and closed-loop systems to enhance sustainability and efficiency. Innovations include bioleaching for low-grade ores and blockchain for traceability. These advancements aim to reduce environmental impact while improving operational efficiency.

title: Robert Friedland Warns of Copper Crisis
summary: Robert Friedland has warned that the global economy faces a copper crisis due to accelerating demand that may outstrip supply within two decades. Copper is crucial for economic growth and national security, but current prices are insufficient to justify new mine developments. Friedland suggests that copper prices need to reach $15,000 per tonne to stimulate production.

title: LME nickel prices rebound on Oct 24, boosted by higher demand in China
summary: LME nickel futures prices rebounded on October 24, closing at US$22,248/ton, up by US$299. The spot price also rose by US$302, reaching US$22,151/ton, driven by increased demand in China.

title: Nickel Futures Fall to Over 1-Month Low Amid Oversupply from Indonesia
summary: Nickel prices fell to around $15,241 per tonne on October 24, down 0.61% from the previous day, with futures dropping below $15,100 per tonne—the lowest in over a month. The decline is attributed to oversupply from Indonesia, which has pushed LME inventories to a record high of 308,000 tons.

title: [SMM Nickel Daily Review] Nickel Prices Rebounded on October 24 as the Fourth Plenary Session Sent Positive Signals
summary: On October 24, the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaged 122,900 yuan/mt, up 750 yuan/mt from the previous day. The rebound in nickel prices was influenced by positive signals from the Fourth Plenary Session.

title: Nickel Price Collapse Forces Market Repricing as Oversupply and Weak Demand Challenge Producers
summary: Nickel prices collapsed to approximately US$15,000 per tonne in mid-2025 due to oversupply and weak demand. Additional pressures include US dollar strength and tariffs on imports from major producers like Indonesia and Russia, causing supply chain realignment and pricing bifurcation.

title: Philippines poised to gain as nickel steadies, gold peaks in 2026
summary: Nickel prices are expected to remain subdued in the near term before recovering later in the decade. The Philippines is positioned to benefit from this trend, while gold prices are projected to reach record highs in 2026.

title: Russia's Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Nornickel reaffirmed its nickel production forecast for 2025 at 196,000 to 204,000 tons despite challenges from equipment modernization and import substitution programs. The company reported an 18% increase in nickel production in Q3 compared to Q2, attributing earlier declines to a transition to new mining equipment and seasonal port disruptions.

title: Nornickel Nickel Production Forecast: 196-204K Tons 2025
summary: Nornickel confirmed its 2025 nickel production target of 196,000 to 204,000 metric tons amid ongoing equipment modernization challenges. The company is undergoing a gradual replacement of Western mining equipment to ensure operational independence, causing temporary production adjustments but expected to improve long-term efficiency.

title: SPC Nickel evaluates Lockerby East's potential
summary: SPC Nickel has started a 1,000m diamond drilling program at the Lockerby East Project in Ontario, Canada, to assess potential new nickel-copper-platinum group metals discoveries. The project targets high-quality Sudbury-style massive sulphide mineralization with promising grades and proximity to past producing mines.

title: Philippines poised to gain as nickel steadies, gold peaks in 2026
summary: Nickel prices are expected to remain subdued in the near term but recover later in the decade, positioning the Philippines to benefit from steady nickel production. The outlook also notes gold prices are projected to reach record highs in 2026.

title: Vale Indonesia (INCO) Targets 71,234 Tons of Nickel Production in 2025
summary: Vale Indonesia aims to produce approximately 71,234 tons of nickel-in-matte in 2025, exceeding its 2024 target. This production increase reflects the company's growth plans in the nickel sector.

title: Unleashing sustainable nickel production for a net zero future
summary: This article explores how optimizing nickel production, particularly through High Pressure Acid Leaching (HPAL), can reduce environmental impact and carbon footprint, supporting a sustainable battery industry globally. It highlights efforts in pollution prevention, biodiversity conservation, energy efficiency, and supply chain transparency to improve nickel production sustainability.

title: Nickel Supply Woes: Innovations Steering a Sustainable EV Future
summary: The article discusses trends in battery technology emphasizing nickel's role and strategies to manage nickel demand sustainably. It covers material innovation like low-nickel batteries, battery recycling to create a circular economy, and boosting domestic battery production and mining capacities supported by financial incentives such as the U.S. Inflation Reduction Act.

title: Nornickel Nickel Production Forecast: 196-204K Tons 2025
summary: Nornickel maintains its 2025 nickel production forecast despite equipment modernization challenges, signaling confidence in operational stability amid growing demand for battery metals. The company is undergoing a transition to domestic mining equipment to improve long-term efficiency and reduce reliance on Western suppliers.

title: US and Australia Launch Critical Minerals Partnership for 2025
summary: The US and Australia have formed a $1 billion partnership to enhance critical minerals supply chains, focusing on increasing battery material recycling efficiency to 40% by 2030 and advancing circular economy principles. The partnership also targets market transparency, fair trading practices, and innovation in alternative materials to reduce supply risks.

title: Powering the future: advances in nickel-based batteries
summary: This article highlights recent technological advances in nickel-based lithium-ion batteries, including increased nickel content in NMC cathodes and the adoption of the 4680 battery format. These innovations improve energy density and vehicle range, reinforcing nickel's critical role in electric vehicle battery development.

title: New Technology Set to Revolutionize Nickel Pollution Cleanup
summary: A new technology has been developed to significantly improve nickel pollution cleanup, aiming to enhance environmental protection related to nickel mining and processing. This innovation supports cleaner air and water by addressing nickel contamination more effectively.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali Launches Pilot Phase of Green Hydrogen Project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has launched the pilot phase of its green hydrogen project in Aosta, Italy. The project aims to reduce carbon emissions by using electrolysis to produce green hydrogen. The project is supported by funding from Italy's National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali to Benefit from Enhanced Energy Performance
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali will enhance its energy performance and reduce environmental impact through a Memorandum of Understanding with CVA. This agreement supports regional decarbonization targets and improves economic competitiveness.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Continuous Casting Machine Modernization at Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has contracted Danieli Service for a modernization project at its works in Aosta, Italy. The project focuses on modernizing a continuous casting machine.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris to showcase its strong presence, advanced product solutions at OMC 2023
summary: Tenaris is highlighting its advanced portfolio of solutions at the OMC Med Energy Conference and Exhibition in Ravenna, Italy, emphasizing its support for complex energy projects in Europe and the Mediterranean with high-quality OCTG and line pipe products, as well as services for low carbon energy applications.

title: Tenaris is a worldsteel Sustainability Champion for eighth consecutive year
summary: Tenaris has been recognized as a worldsteel Sustainability Champion for the eighth year in a row, reflecting its leadership in sustainable practices across environmental, social, and governance metrics. The company continues to invest in decarbonization, renewable energy, and operational efficiency across its global facilities, including in Italy.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris recently hosted a panel in Italy on the future of nuclear energy and boilermaking, bringing together industry and institutional experts to discuss nuclear's role in Europe's energy transition. The company's Italian mill has also received accreditation to supply materials for nuclear facilities, meeting the highest international standards.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa to enhance energy security. Installation will be carried out by the Prysmian Monna Lisa vessel along the Strait of Sicily.

title: Prysmian Secures €460m Contract For Italy–Tunisia Subsea Power Link
summary: Prysmian announced winning a $536.59 million contract to build a submarine power cable connecting Italy and Tunisia. This project is part of the Elmed Project to enhance energy interconnection between the two countries.

title: Prysmian Named As Preferred Bidder For Major UK High Voltage Energy Interconnection Project
summary: Prysmian was named preferred bidder for a major UK high voltage energy interconnection project, reflecting its leadership in submarine cable technology. Although this is UK-focused, it highlights Prysmian's ongoing global expansion and technological investments, including in Italy.

title: Raul Gil: Submarine cables and high-tech solutions to counter low-tech attacks
summary: At the Italian Energy Summit 2025, Raul Gil, EVP Transmission at Prysmian, discussed the importance of security and innovative technologies in submarine cables. This underscores Prysmian's commitment to advancing cable technology and protecting critical infrastructure in Italy and beyond.
